messages.message:
I added a new GRPC function last week and now its usage in api-server is resulting in a typecheck error. 

All the generated files are there and RepoServiceStub does have the mentioned function. Anyone encountered this before?

Have you generated the protos? Try:
```cd api-server
make build-protos```

Ya I've seen this before. You have to also edit the _grpc.pyi function as well to pass the mypy checks. Add a function definition for the rpc function you created.

Was this merged in and had passed CI tests?

Here's a PR that I recently put up. https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/43925

I edited the `shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/stubs/instabase/protos/repo_service/repo_service_pb2_grpc.pyi` file to pass mypy.

Do the same thing for whichever proto file you had edited.
Yep, any (RPC functions) updates to the protos need to be manually added to the _grpc.pyi file
Ah makes sense. Didnâ€™t know there is a manual aspect to this too

This manual action should only be relavent when you add a new rpc function I think not when you just edit a proto. I'm still confused on how this had passed CI when mypy fails on api-server :thinking_face:
Oh yes, of course,  added RPC functions to the original reply.:slightly_smiling_face:
